item.title: Color = context. Work smarter, avoid mistakes
item.description: Ever clicked in your app and wondered: Am I in DEV or PRD now? Mistakes happen. Mis-clicks happen. And worst case: you update data in the wrong environment. In this blog: a simple pattern to make your app visually aware ‚Äî based on environment. üéØ The idea in short Create an environment variable (e.g. CurrentEnvironment) with possible values DEV, ACC, PRD In your app, use logic to pick a color based on that value Result: the UI itself signals which environment you‚Äôre in Color = Context.

item.title: Export Dataverse data to Excel triggered from Canvas app
item.description: Introduction Over a year ago I already wrote stated something we jokingly say: ‚ÄúWhat is the most frequently used functionality of an ERP system?‚Äù, with as the answer: ‚Äú‚Ä¶the export to Excel‚Äù. It is still an often request, which is there by default while creating a Model Driven app, while end-users often would like to export data in a Canvas app as well. This blog describes how to create a Power Automate flow which you can trigger via Canvas app to export the data from Dataverse into Excel.
